intro: Ornithogalum karachabpoortense, commonly known as the Karachabpoort lily, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It has linear, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powder. Ornithogalum karachabpoortense is a perennial herb that blooms during the summer months.
